thread.title: NDSU starting quarterback Carson Wentz suffers wrist injury
thread.title_full: NDSU starting quarterback Carson Wentz suffers wrist injury

title: NDSU starting quarterback Carson Wentz suffers wrist injury
text:
North Dakota State starting quarterback Carson Wentz suffers wrist injury; extent unknown THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   10:20   10:20   
Subjects: 
North Dakota (276) 

FARGO, North Dakota — North Dakota State University has confirmed that starting quarterback Carson Wentz suffered a wrist injury during Saturday's game against South Dakota. 
Bison athletic department spokesman Ryan Perreault (pur-AHLT') said Tuesday morning that Wentz had a medical appointment scheduled, and the school planned to release more details later in the day. 
Perreault said Wentz suffered the injury in the team's 24-21 loss to USD on Saturday in Fargo, but he did not elaborate. 
NDSU is the four-time defending Football Championship Subdivision champion. The Bison are 4-2 this season after the upset loss to the Coyotes that ended NDSU's 26-game home winning streak. 
Wentz is a senior from Bismarck. His backup is redshirt freshman Easton Stick, of Omaha, Nebraska. 
NDSU travels to Indiana State on Saturday.
